page.title: 15LIFESTYLES
page.content: Until 1982 a public house was on the site called the Three Horseshoes.When it changed to a restaurant the owner decided to call it The Shoes because the local people had abreviated the name of the pub to 'the shoes'. The owner has also started to collect ornamental shoes and has over forty. The restaurant opens at 7.30pm every evening and also for Sunday lunches.There is seating for forty downstairs and twenty upstairs.The menu is very FRench with dishes such as 'Mushrooms a le Grecque' and 'Sirlon au Rognons'.Although the patrons come from a wide area,the employees are mainly local.The building is over 300 years old and is a grade 2 listed building.Recently the ghost of a man who died there wassaid to have been seen upstairs
